title: BFramework
description: 2D game framework made with Java’s AWT/Swing libraries. Was the foundation for a game which won 2nd place internationally in TSA’s Video Game Design/Programming competition in 2017.

title: Backus-Naur Sentence Generator
description: Website that can randomly generate sentences from predefined Backus-Naur Form (BNF) machine grammars, much to one's general amusement.

title: Resume
description: My professional resume, made using HTML & CSS to suitably showcase web development abilities.

title: Business Card
description: My personal business card, made with HTML & CSS.

title: Carbon Cycle Simulator
description: Interactive simulation of the carbon cycle, designed and implemented as an activity for high school biology classes. Based on a lesson originally designed by Jennifer Ceven.

title: Personal Website
description: My personal website; currently being rebuilt to use simple PHP instead of an unholy mess of JavaScript. Note: currently published version is old Javascript, and will be udpated to the PHP version when functionality matches.

title: Axis & Allies Dashboard
description: Website to use while playing "Axis & Allies," a WWII-based strategy board game. Cycles through each country’s turn, showing each nation's gamestate (with WWII anthem) and doing all bookkeeping.

title: FMBQ Jump Lights
description: Free alternative to jump seats for the Free Methodist Bible Quizzing competition. Two teams sit on opposite sides of a keyboard with fingers on it for "jumping." Substitutes for $150+ of equipment.

title: BV.game
description: Game built for TSA’s 2018 Video Game Design/Programming event with BFramework V, the fifth complete rebuild of a custom JAVA game engine. Said framework is built into the game code here, instead of being a separate project.

title: Pranks
description: A collection of various files which set up frustrating situations on computers when run. Fun to run on friends' computers while they're distracted, as pranks.

title: Binary Quiz (App Lab)
description: A simple quiz that asks you to categorize words into one of two similar categories! Simple, but addictive. Made with code.org's "App Lab" (currently being ported to iOS & Android)

title: Online Periodic Table
description: An experiment to see how much fancy functionality I can add to something simple by abusing JavaScript. Data from Bowserinator/Periodic-Table-JSON is used for content generation.
